recommendations.title: Henry Winkler Breaks the Curse of Stardom
recommendations.excerpt: Now in his 70s, the pop culture icon has found his true calling on “Barry,” as the king of character actors.

recommendations.title: 27 Words You Should Never Use to Describe Yourself
recommendations.excerpt: Some are incredibly overused. Others just make you sound full of yourself. Either way, you lose.

recommendations.title: What if Russia loses the war in Ukraine?
recommendations.excerpt: It has been a fascinating week for those who analyse the war in Ukraine, and western strategy. First, President Biden sent a request to Congress for $US33 billion ($47 billion) in military, economic and humanitarian aid for Ukraine.

recommendations.title: 12 Simple Ways for Men to Lose Weight After 50
recommendations.excerpt: A few small shifts help you shed extra pounds.

recommendations.title: On the Disappearing of Joan Vollmer Burroughs
recommendations.excerpt: After William Burroughs killed his wife Joan Vollmer, he threw away all her possessions. Their son, Bill Jr., never saw a photograph of her. When Bill Jr. was 32, he begged his father to send him a photo but he didn’t. Allen Ginsberg tried to show him a photo of her dead face, though.

recommendations.title: The 19th-Century Hipster Who Pioneered Modern Sportswriting
recommendations.excerpt: More than a century before GoPro, Thomas Stevens’ around-the-world bike ride vaulted first-person “sports porn” into the mainstream.

recommendations.title: These Are the 6 Best Mobility Exercises for Longevity, According to an Occupational Therapist
recommendations.excerpt: When it comes to physical activity, the equation is fairly straightforward: The more we move, the better our bodies are able to support movement. However, the converse is also true. The more sedentary we are, the stiffer and weaker we get, so the more difficult movement becomes.

recommendations.title: Humans Can’t Quit a Basic Myth About Dog Breeds
recommendations.excerpt: Breed doesn’t have that big an effect on a dog’s personality.

recommendations.title: What Imola DRS delay told us about F1 2022 overtaking
recommendations.excerpt: Race control’s decision not to let Formula 1 drivers use the drag reduction system until lap 35 of the 63-lap Emilia Romagna Grand Prix proved a huge talking point among fans.

recommendations.title: Netflix’s Big Wake-Up Call: The Power Clash Behind the Crash
recommendations.excerpt: As rivals toggle between schadenfreude and fear, top creators and insiders are increasingly becoming vocal about what’s gone wrong with the streaming giant’s culture.

recommendations.title: How Putin’s invasion returned Nato to the centre stage
recommendations.excerpt: Nato is back. With the invasion of Ukraine, Vladimir Putin has single-handedly revived the fortunes of the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation, returning it to the top of the foreign policy agenda. Nordic states that once prided themselves on independence from the organisation are now eager to join.

recommendations.title: Their mom died of COVID. They say conspiracy theories are what really killed her
recommendations.excerpt: One thing everyone agrees on is that Stephanie didn't have to die. Even months after it happened, her family is struggling to figure out why. Stephanie was 75 when she succumbed to COVID-19 this past December. But Laurie says it wasn't just COVID that killed her mother.

recommendations.title: 7 ocean mysteries scientists haven’t solved yet
recommendations.excerpt: And the adventures scientists go on to better understand our enigmatic seas. The Earth is mainly a water world — more than 70 percent of its surface is covered by oceans — and yet we know so little about what resides beneath the waves.

recommendations.title: The Worst Boyfriend on the Upper East Side
recommendations.excerpt: For decades, a man has romanced New York women, persuading them to invest in questionable business deals. How did he keep running the same scam?

recommendations.title: Does time really exist?
recommendations.excerpt: In a philosophical sense, we’re taught to doubt and question everything.

recommendations.title: 8 popular misconceptions about the history of witchcraft in Europe
recommendations.excerpt: Professor Owen Davies addresses eight popular misconceptions about the history of witchcraft in Europe.

recommendations.title: Bugs Across Globe Are Evolving to Eat Plastic, Study Finds
recommendations.excerpt: Surprising discovery shows scale of plastic pollution and reveals enzymes that could boost recycling.

recommendations.title: Barneys Fantasia
recommendations.excerpt: In 1923, Barney Pressman pawned his wife’s engagement ring for five hundred dollars and opened a five-hundred-square-foot clothing store on West Seventeenth Street and Seventh Avenue, in downtown Manhattan, where he sold well-tailored menswear at steep discounts.

recommendations.title: How to Actually Stay Calm During an Argument
recommendations.excerpt: You can feel it brewing in the seconds leading up to a big argument. You temper flares, you feel flushed, and you’re suddenly ready to say aloud things you know you will never be able to take back.

recommendations.title: The Decisive Moment: What Henri Cartier-Bresson Actually Meant
recommendations.excerpt: The photographic master Henri Cartier-Bresson made some key observations about photography, translated as “the decisive moment” which is often (incorrectly) characterized as: “capturing an event that is ephemeral and spontaneous, where the image represents the essence of the event itself.

recommendations.title: 3 things to say no to if you want to succeed
recommendations.excerpt: The author of Creative Doing reminds everyone to let the other people chase the quick wins and glittering lures. Focus on your craft and your life’s task instead.

recommendations.title: What Your Profile Picture Says About Your Personality, According to a Life Coach
recommendations.excerpt: What’s in a profile picture? Well, quite a lot according to life coach Francesca Tighinean.

recommendations.title: The last phone boxes: broken glass, cider cans and – amazingly – a dial tone
recommendations.excerpt: There used to be a phone box at the top of my street. It stood in the middle of a traffic island, near a bin, a lamp-post and a bollard. I never questioned the presence of the phone box, just as I never questioned the presence of the bin, the lamp-post or the bollard.

recommendations.title: How QR Codes Work and What Makes Them Dangerous—a Computer Scientist Explains
recommendations.excerpt: Here’s what happens when you scan one of those ubiquitous two-dimensional black-and-white patterns.

recommendations.title: “We’re going to disrupt”: A year inside GB News
recommendations.excerpt: When Angelos Frangopoulos addressed his newly assembled staff in early May last year, the atmosphere was jubilant, giddy even: that curious cocktail of carefully curated rebellion that only a start-up can provide.

recommendations.title: How to take things less personally
recommendations.excerpt: Always blaming yourself or assuming others think ill of you? A CBT therapist shares ways to break these self-critical habits The other day, I found out that one of my close friends had an extra ticket to a football playoff game, and he invited another friend instead of me.

recommendations.title: What the Best Presenters Do Differently
recommendations.excerpt: According to Pulitzer Prize–winning historian Doris Kearns Goodwin, villagers would come from far and wide to hear Abraham Lincoln, then a prairie lawyer with a gift for storytelling. Lincoln didn’t have the benefit of modern technology.

recommendations.title: Garden wildlife jobs for May
recommendations.excerpt: May is a busy time in the wildlife garden. Birds are busy feeding their young, while pollinators such as bumblebees, butterflies and hoverflies are taking advantage of the mild conditions and abundance of flowers.

recommendations.title: Honey, let’s track the kids: the rise of parental surveillance
recommendations.excerpt: Phone apps now allow parents to follow every move their children make. But does keeping them safe come at a price?

recommendations.title: The song that Dave Grohl called “the most beautiful piece of music ever written”
recommendations.excerpt: Whether you love him or loath him – and fewer people loath his than chocolate – Dave Grohl is one of the finest songwriters of our time. For some reason, this is perhaps less recognised than it should be.
